reviews.sentence: Great location Great employees below average room. We arrived late to our hotel around 80 pm. I knew it was going to be a great trip when we were greeted by Ben in the courtyard. He was very jolly and welcoming and informed us that with a quick walk to the pier we could still catch the fireworks after we checked in. At the front desk we were greeted by Julian who could not be nicer. He sent a nice welcome note happy birthday card and a dish of fresh fruit to our room. I knew this was the best place for us for this Chicago TripPrior to check in we contacted in house reservations Amy. who suggested our room letting us know it would be the best for my husband myself and my teenage son. It was a king with a pull out queen sofa. We also confirmed our reservation online and requested 2 extra pillows and 2 extra towels. When we opened the door to our room I immediately knew Amy never had a teenage son. The room was pleasant enough but small. When we unpacked our clothes there were two items of under garments left in a drawer. Also there were no extra pillows or towels that we requested nor were there any blankets for the pull out sofa. The bathroom was in need of a remodel the TP holder was falling off the wall the wallpaper was in disrepair. The phone in the room never worked correctly even after service had been there to repair it twice. Ben was correct it was a 5 minute walk to the pier and the hotel is in a great location walking distance to the miracle mile or a very short cab ride to other areas of Chicago. Kimberly at the Concierge Desk also worked hard and hooked us up with great tickets to see Kinky Boots dinner reservations at RPM Italian and a great driver to take us to White Sox Stadium. The pool area was great on the roof of the 5th floor.
Great chicago. Great location the hotel is accommodating and it was well priced near everything i was surprised serves breakfast and close to many restaurants.
Great Chicago location. You can not beat the location. Walking distance to restaurants Michigan Ave. movie theaters and all the major attractions. Good gym.
Good location. Hotel is within walking distance to a lot of sites and restaurants. It was clean staff was friendly and rooms were what you had expect.

Great location. Great view. Stayed during an official visit. The room rates were quite reasonable we could pay in Indian Rupees from online booking. The room was perfect as expected from a Hilton. The hotel is located very near the local attractions and one could easily walk. Good restaurants including Indian restaurant and subway are nearby. View from the rooms facing the waterfront is awesome.

No way worth the price or points. Had business in Chicago so booked a couple extra days to relax. Ended stay a day early. Used 500 Hilton honor points for this old hotel which is being propped up with a lot of fresh paint. Rooms are very small. No fridge microwave. U can use mini fridge but be prepared to explain removing items in there if u get charged. our cabinet door broke off when we opened. There really is no water view due to buildings and we were near the top floor corner suite. No executive lounge for Hilton honor members. Also H diamond members only get bread fruit oatmeal and cereal for breakfast. Up charge for anything else. Parking is 50. ouch24 for thirty minutes. I will not return. I did find front desk to be very kind. You can walk to Navy Pier and several restaurants easily.

Appalling Stay. To say my experience at this establishment was abhorrent would not begin to cover the awful weekend that this hotel specifically Michael Brown did to me and the group I was with. After traveling to Chicago for a celebration with 10 other women the woman who checked us in at the hotel was lovely and even sent up champagne to celebrate the occasion. We went up to our rooms and gathered in the middle of the three rooms we rented. Then a mere 4 hours later we received a knock on the door from hotel security telling us there was a noise complaint and to be quiet. After we actively worked on reducing our noise level however just 45 minutes later we had another knock on the door at 1030pm on a Friday. We were greeted by the same hotel security man along with 6 Chicago police officers in bullet proofs vests the hotel told the police we had 40 people when they knew there were only 11 of us who told us we had to collect our belongings and leave because we were n’t quiet enough. Yes after one in person warning we were being evicted from the hotel rooms we paid for. We asked to speak to the manager Michael Brown to discuss our options and ultimately see if we could be refunded. Mr Brown arrived and refused to engage in discussion about the situation. I ’ve never seen anyone hospitality industry acted so rude unprofessional. It bogles the mind. After asking the front desk about their noise policy they admitted it was a one strike subjective policy. Once again I struggle to understand how a corporation deems this acceptable. The next day we called to check on our hotel reservations and everything seemed fine. We received new keys went to our original rooms got ready for dinner and left the hotel. We returned the hotel to find all of our belongs in trash bags outside of the rooms. The hotel did n’t even have the decency to call us to warn us. Naturally Mr Brown was the manager again. I will never stay at a DoubleTree or a Hilton again. A hotel that treats their guests as criminals does not deserve business.

Value for money. Excellent location. Good access to the lake and the magnificent mile. Very close to the shopping area and convenient location for public transport. The continental breakfast was good how about we did not try a hot breakfast.
Nice hotel with spacious rooms and nice furnishings. They offer a free cookie or fruit during check in very nice. Staff is friendly. Einstein on the ground floor is a nice bonus. Excellent location.

Run down. No restaurant only bar food. Lovely Lobby Bar which is never open. Bad. The restaurant had closed. Only bar food available. False advertising. Website says hotel has a restaurant but it does not. Also the Lobby Bar was never open. Very poor. Overpriced. Hotel is a bit run down. Not worth 350 per night even if it is peak period. Bar and restaurant never open. False advertising. do not stay here.

Not Recommended. I stay at Hilton properties enough to have Gold status. I wo n’t be back to this place for a long time. It ’s under a big renovation right now. The construction noise started just before 8 am. The lobby is sort of a crowded mess as is the front entrance. Parking is expensive 55 day not valet. The AC unit was pretty loud as well. They gave us coupon for the buffet breakfast. When we got there we realized it was only for the cold items not eggs biscuits or bacon from the buffet. My opinion pay a little more for the Embassy 1 block away.

Wonderful. LocationCleanLarge room if you take kingBeautiful viewPol open till 11 pm which is great if you have kids or looking for a relaxing nightCheck out at noon that ’s amazing. time to do breakfast pack your bags. Noise of the airco outside. Like sitting in an airplane argh.

7 Rooms Booked. Very good location convenient but expensive parking. Rooms were nice clean enough space to move around in. Comfortable bed and good linens. Bathrooms were a little tired in most of all the rooms. Breakfast buffet had a good selection price should be a little more acesible to guests staying at the hotel. Front desk was not very helpful when calling them from the room with a question was put on hold several times. Internet was not acesible at all and front desk was no help.

What could have been was not. Spent several days here for a convention. Hotel renovations going on. Supposedly they had 2 elevators for guests to use to reach all 25 floors but one was out of order most of the week 9though they never marked it as such it just did not work. manager seemed unconcerned when it was brought tohis attention multiple times. They also had 2 elevators blocked off for the construction people to use most of which stayed open on the ground floor. Clearly customers were not the first order of business for this manager and the rest of our stay demonstrated that. The facilty is nice enough and the meal service staff were quite nice. Very limited food service as the whole restaurant is guted and being re built. Overall this hotel just is not run up to snuff for the standards Doubletree proclaims.
A comfy oasis in Chicago. Bed was amazing and location was great. Asked front desk to hold our bags while we ate breakfast she went to get the bellhop and forgot about us.

Great location and great price. Location is close the lake and Michigan Avenue. Restaurants and grocerg stores are nearby including Target. The rooms are spacious and cleanParking is too expensive. Therefore I recommend finding somewhere else to park.

Great location. Attended the Cubs Convention and stayed only 3 miles away. Used online check in chose own room digital key. Smooth sailing. Would definitely stay again. Stopped into bar for a cocktail. Very inviting.

A convenient place to stay in Chicago when visiting Northwestern Medical Campus. The Doubletree is a convenient place to stay in the city when visiting Northwestern Medical Center. Clean and nicely appointed hotel. My only negative comment is that you can not get breakfast in your room in the morning and must go to the restaurant. This was disappointing because I like to relax early in the morning in my room.

Good. great location spacious and pleasant room very comfortable bed. On arrival in reception there was a row of 6 people and no one came to help the only boy. They forgot to give us breakfast tickets in the morning I had to lose 15 minutes to get them.

Service. The service was good and everything went great. Please add complimentary breakfast or happy hour for guests. This would help attract more customers to the hotel and increase the overall experience of the hotel.

Great service at a great price. Ca n’t go wrong with this hotel. Its only 2 blocks away from Michigan Ave and all of its shopping. But the real star is Jurnel Terry. he is a Barista inside the cafe in the lobby. Wow wow wow. My bf and I were there for the Chicago marathon and he literally not only learned our names where we were from and our story. He celebrated all marathoners everyday but went above and beyond to make everyone feel welcomed and special. He was so genuine and honestly would be a fantastic selection for growth within the company specially in leadership development or team building. Jurnel made our day every day. Thank you Jurnel for being simply a phenomenal person. We will definitely be back.

I had a 3 night stay. The property was well kept Clean There were some really attentive and extremely helpful staffs while there were a few that were n’t so much. Besides the hotel being decent it did n’t have much more too offer. THEY DONT offer breakfast in bed. No room service for breakfast which was extremely disappointing. The breakfast buffet was 25p and it did n’t even offer pancakes as a selection. Food had no flavor staff in the breakfast area were rude with the exception of a gentleman who was very nice and helpful. As we were seated we walked over to the tiny area available for the breakfast buffet. My boyfriend and I began to serve ourselves asked for pancakes or waffles which were not available at the buffet and we were told we ’d have to order them from the actual menu. When the menu was handed to us the waffles were 179. And the pancakes another 100. Of course we did n’t order none of them considering the buffet was already 25 plus tax and of course gratuity. We pursue to eat our breakfast and as we take our first bite nothing had any taste. At that point I dropped my fork and we decided to go elsewhere. My bf and I are complete foodies. We love food and do n’t mind paying but these prices for the minimal selection they had to offer was NOT worth it. I ’ve stayed at multiple HILTONS and they usually offer some amazing breakfasts and room service. Not this place. They do have a mini Starbucks. We Wo n’t be returning that ’s for sure.
